text: The Drakeia massacre () refers to the mass execution of 118 men by SS soldiers in the village of Drakeia, located on Mount Pelion, in Thessaly, on 18 December 1943. Out of the 350 houses, 58 were destroyed. It was part of the multiple Nazi reprisals against the Greek Resistance in occupied Greece.Van Boeschoten, Riki, "Broken Bonds and Divided Memories: Long-term Effects of War Atrocities in a Greek Mountain Village", European Association of Social Anthropologists (2004)Foot, John, Italy's Divided Memory, Palgrave Macmillan (2009) p.146 A wake in memory of the victims is held in the area every year, in the presence of members of the Greek Parliament and the President of Greece. ==References== Category:Nazi war crimes in Greece Category:1943 in Greece Category:Mass murder in 1943 Category:Conflicts in 1943 Category:Massacres in the 1940s Category:Massacres in Greece during World War II Category:Massacres_of_men Category:Thessaly in World War II Category:December 1943 events Category:Violence against men in Europe
